info.title: Currency
info.description:
Merchants who use Shopify Payments can allow customers to pay in their local currency on the online store. When a customer selects a currency, all prices on the online store and checkout are automatically converted to that currency. Merchants enable the currencies that they want to offer to customers from their Shopify Payments settings.

The Currency resource represents a currency that the merchant has enabled. For each enabled currency, the Currency resource returns the currency code and the time when its conversion rate was last updated.

paths.description: Retrieves a list of currencies enabled on a shop
paths.summary: Retrieves a list of currencies enabled on a shop

200.description: Retrieves a list of currencies enabled on a shop

x-examples.name: Retrieve a list of currencies enabled on a shop

codeSamples.example_code:
test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::Currency.all(
  session: test_session,
)

properties.description: The three-letter code (ISO 4217 format) for the currency associated with this setting.
properties.name: currency

properties.description: The date and time (ISO 8601 format) when the conversion rate associated with this currency was last updated. If manual FX rates are active on a shop, then the updated date of these rates will replace the automatic conversion rates. Conversion rates are checked every 15 minutes, but typically updated only a few times a day. Manual FX rates are updated at the merchant's request.
properties.name: rate_updated_at

x-shopify-meta.meta_description: Retrieve a list of enabled currencies and the time when their conversion rate was last updated.
